issue.title: Fix a false positive for ``redefined-outer-name``

labels.name: False Positive ü¶ü
labels.description: A message is emitted but nothing is wrong with the code

repository.name: pylint
repository.description: It's not just a linter that annoys you!

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you for submitting a PR to pylint!

To ease the process of reviewing your PR, do make sure to complete the following boxes.

- [ ] Document your change, if it is a non-trivial one.
  - A maintainer might label the issue ``skip-news`` if the change does not need to be in the changelog.
  - Otherwise, create a news fragment with ``towncrier create <IssueNumber>.<type>`` which will be
    included in the changelog. ``<type>`` can be one of the types defined in `./towncrier.toml`.
    If necessary you can write details or offer examples on how the new change is supposed to work.
  - Generating the doc is done with ``tox -e docs``
- [ ] Relate your change to an issue in the tracker if such an issue exists (Refs #1234, Closes #1234)
- [ ] Write comprehensive commit messages and/or a good description of what the PR does.
- [ ] Keep the change small, separate the consensual changes from the opinionated one.
  Don't hesitate to open multiple PRs if the change requires it. If your review is so
  big it requires to actually plan and allocate time to review, it's more likely
  that it's going to go stale.
- [ ] If you used multiple emails or multiple names when contributing, add your mails
      and preferred name in ``script/.contributors_aliases.json``
-->

## Type of Changes

<!-- Leave the corresponding lines for the applicable type of change: -->

|     | Type                   |
| --- | ---------------------- |
| ‚úì   | :bug: Bug fix          |
|    | :sparkles: New feature |
|    | :hammer: Refactoring   |
|    | :scroll: Docs          |

## Description
Fix a false positive for ``redefined-outer-name`` when there is a name defined in an exception-handling block which shares the same name as a local variable that has been defined in a function body.

<!-- If this PR references an issue without fixing it: -->


<!-- If this PR fixes an issue, use the following to automatically close when we merge: -->

Closes #9671

body:
@mbyrnepr2, this attempt:
https://github.com/pylint-dev/pylint/blob/805663a8493166812322f86a52b7df4490fbf09a/pylint/checkers/variables.py#L1523-L1524
doesn't make much sense because the same behavior is observed when the order is reversed:
```python
# pylint: disable=missing-module-docstring, missing-function-docstring
try:
    raise ValueError('outer')
except ValueError as e:
    print(e)

def f():
    try:
        raise ValueError('inner')
    except ValueError as e:
        print(e)
```
```
a.py:10:4: W0621: Redefining name 'e' from outer scope (line 4) (redefined-outer-name)
```
Pylint should really understand that the variable from `except ... as ...:` doesn't exist outside the except block.
If it would help, this is what [Python documentation](https://docs.python.org/3/reference/compound_stmts.html#except-clause) says:
> When an exception has been assigned using `as target`, it is cleared at the end of the `except` clause. This is as if
> ```python
> except E as N:
>    foo
>```
> was translated to
> ```python
> except E as N:
>    try:
>        foo
>    finally:
>        del N
>```
As a side note, Pylint apparently doesn't understand explicit `del` either (I'm not saying that using it to redefine variables can be considered ‚Äúgood‚Äù, but if Pylint had working logic for `del`, it could be used for correcting this `except` problem).

Thank you @MikhailRyazanov. That indeed makes plenty of sense!
I've taken an alternative approach and perhaps this can be a workable solution for this case.
FYI since you mentioned `del` there is some reading you can check out [here](https://github.com/pylint-dev/pylint/issues/841) on that.

issue.title: Release branch 3.2.3

repository.name: pylint
repository.description: It's not just a linter that annoys you!

issue.body:
What's new in Pylint 3.2.3?
---------------------------
Release date: 2024-06-06


False Positives Fixed
---------------------

- Classes with only an Ellipsis (``...``) in their body do not trigger 'multiple-statements'
  anymore if they are inlined (in accordance with black's 2024 style).

  Closes #9398 

- Fix a false positive for ``redefined-outer-name`` when there is a name defined in an exception-handling block which shares the same name as a local variable that has been defined in a function body.

  Closes #9671 

- Fix a false positive for ``use-yield-from`` when using the return value from the ``yield`` atom.

  Closes #9696
